website_summaries.verdict: Works with many compression stockings and is a good choice for customers with larger feet. It still might not be large enough for severely swollen feet or lymphadema patients.
pros: Latex-free plastic shell contours to slide over the foot and heel
Comfort grip foam handles with 3 centimeter foam padding
Wide, slip-resistant cuff ensures the sock does not slide off of the aid
Cords  are  33" in length and can be adjusted with button adjusters
Many can use with compression socks, although still too small for those with lymphadema
Larger, rounded shape makes it sturdier and more helpful
cons: May be too wide for customers with small socks and feet

customer_reviews.title: Great assistance device
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my husband to make life easier after knee replacement. I usually helped him with his compression stockings, but left for work on day forgetting all about them. He called me and said he got them on by himself with the help of this item. I can't tell you how impressed I am about how easy they go on with this. HIGHLY... recommend this item. Makes life much easier and very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Mugsy

customer_reviews.title: Not a useful device for womens small socks
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item because the hospitals physical therapist said i'd need it after my hip replacement. She even showed me how to use it, with the hospital slipper sox, everyone gets while in the hospital. I tried using it with those sox, very easy. So I bought one when i got home, trouble is, my socks, being a woman would Not fit over the huge device. So unless i always wore those hospital sox, which i could put on myself at home, this sock assist does not come close to actually getting a woman sock over it. If you're a woman don't buy it. If you're a man, buy it.
customer_reviews.author: DiamondGirl

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and works great! I have a compression fracture of the spine, which makes bending over very painful. Before I got the Sock Assist, it was a daily struggle just to put my socks on. But with the help of this clever little gadget, I can now do it without any pain. It's been a godsend for me.
customer_reviews.author: Dora A.

customer_reviews.title: this helper works better than the other one i had which had just ...
customer_reviews.text: this helper works better than the other one i had which had just a single round grabber on the back,this one pulls a lot more of the sock up my leg .i am talking about compression socks only! the plastic part is wider than the other one so it does not grab my little toe. i will buy another one if this one breaks down in a year or so,i recommend this one for guy's that have bigger feet than most.thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not clear on what it was to do
customer_reviews.text: Not what I expected or need. The stocking would not even go on the device, as the pad at the bottom prevented this. And it only was supposed to get the stocking on the foot. I needed one that would bring the stocking up the leg. The ad and instructions were not very clear on this. I returned the device to the place I bought it from
customer_reviews.author: goofygirl

customer_reviews.title: Save your money!!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is useless, I have been trying to put these stockings on this "sock assist" for 45minutes, and can not get them on. Granted they are 30-40mmhg and I figured they would be hard to put on but couldn't get them half way on before the bad language started. So if you have the heavy compression stockings, save your money!!
customer_reviews.author: SMZ

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and great value from a professional seller!
customer_reviews.text: A very helpful, well designed product. It should last a long time. It allows me to properly put on my right sock, which may be permanently something I need (I am doing stretch exercises to improve the situation, but not improving enough). Your unit is superior to wht I have been using and appears to be more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Pull them
customer_reviews.text: Wearing compression stockings is difficult enough so trying them on shouldn’t be that difficult. Unfortunately it is :( this product is wonderful and made putting my compression stockings on with ease. I would definitely recommend the product.
customer_reviews.author: Rachelle Westerman

customer_reviews.title: Cannot be used for compression stockings
customer_reviews.text: I have returned this for a refund. I bought it as an aid in putting on compression stockings but it is too rigid to pull a compression stocking onto the device.
customer_reviews.author: RF

customer_reviews.title: Only good for getting your toes in!
customer_reviews.text: The product will get your sock on over your toes, but will not pull it up over your heel and up your leg for you. We just wasted $10. It would be okay if your mobility allows you to bend enough to grab your sock halfway on your foot and do the rest of the work yourself. If you CAN NOT reach your feet this is NOT for you. If you want your sock to go on all the way, you need to buy the SOCK HORSE (same price).
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: GREAT INVENTION
customer_reviews.text: i WISH i HAD KNOWN ABOUT THIS FOUR YEARS AGO. IT REALLY HELPS TO GET COMPRESSION STOCKING OR REGULAR SOCKS STARTED ON YOUR FOOT/LEG. DON'T HAVE TO BEND AS FAR DOWN TO FINISH PULLING UP. LOVE IT!!!
customer_reviews.author: MCas

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I've been having to ask my husband to help me put on my right sock because I can't bend my knee enough to reach my foot. I finally broke down and got this to see if it helped. If you follow the progression of the pictures. It actually worked! It was very easy. Slipped my sock onto the plastic foot device. Dropped it to the floor and stuck my foot in very easily. Then pulled up with the rope handles. It was on even over the heal (which was the part I was unsure would work). Cheap fix for a frustrating problem.
customer_reviews.author: Kris S

customer_reviews.title: For a small WOmen
customer_reviews.text: The idea is great although the size in my opinion is wrong. The unit is best used by a SMALL women. I am 6' 2' and the unit is worthless for a size 11D foot. A waste of time and could not use it. Another item for Goodwill. I DO NOT recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: vette78

customer_reviews.title: Good product, but not made for large legs.
customer_reviews.text: This item arrived quickly, in great shape. It is well made. My only issue with it is that it is too small. I bought this to use with compression stockings for my lymphedema. So, my calves are very large, and the puller does not fit around my leg. I may be able to enlarge it by soaking it in hot water, but I havent had the time to try it yet. .
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Good for stocks but not compression stocks
customer_reviews.text: Good for putting on regular cotton socks that don't go too high up on the calf, but there is no way these can be used for knee- high compression socks. I tried helping my elderly mom and thre is just no way these can do it. So if you are looking for something to get compression socks on.... get something else.
customer_reviews.author: Bayarea Girl

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product because I am scheduled to have hip replacement surgery and won’t be able to bend over to put on my socks. I have had limited range of motion and so putting on socks has been difficult and painful for some time now. I got the product today and used it. It was so easy to get my socks on. I wish I had gotten this months ago!
customer_reviews.author: Jeanene

customer_reviews.title: KISS ;  Keep it super simple  .
customer_reviews.text: I was that ( Doubting Thomas ) after numerous times considering the purchase. but I, didn’t push in the button. Anyone that’s really familiar with back pain can appreciate how much of a relief it is just putting on a pair of socks without passing out after a 20 minute effort to put on a pair of socks it push me over the edge to find A better solution. To be quite truthful I don't remember how much I paid for the jump rope BUT I would’ve paid twice as much $$... for it.
customer_reviews.author: Frank S.

customer_reviews.title: I can get socks on by myself again!
customer_reviews.text: So this thing is amazing! I developed lymphedema in my legs after radiation on my hip. It's really diminished my range of motion and dressing myself is difficult. I haven't been able to get socks on for 3 months by myself and with fall and winter coming I need to be able to wear them. I came across this and omg! The freedom of putting on my own socks. While it seems cumbersome (and let's face it having to have a device to put on socks is already cumbersome) the device is easy to use and small enough it stores easily out of sight. 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha P.

customer_reviews.title: Easy sock aid
customer_reviews.text: This is great straps are adjustable and the black band on the back hold the compression sock in place. Only wish they made this a little smaller I use small size compression socks and it little to wide. Very easy to use once you set your straps to your preference. Have low back issues and this works great so I am not stretching too far causing more pain.
customer_reviews.author: R Benzing

customer_reviews.title: The SOCK ASSIST is a great improvement over the previous item I no longer use
customer_reviews.text: Having ongoing frequent pain in my back and left knee. I feel for all of you who live with this malady. The SOCK ASSIST is a great improvement over the previous item I no longer use. The heel and leg area is widened enough for me to use the puller a lot easier. I still have some slight problems, but with more work, it should improve. The stretchings lines and the larger handles are an improvement as well. When I get my small problem sorted out I will make this SOCK ASSIST into a five-star rating. Well done!
customer_reviews.author: Rob Everitt

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with compression socks as advertised
customer_reviews.text: My father has to use compression socks and struggles with putting them on every morning. This product stated it was made for compression sock use as well as regular socks. We were not able to even put a compression sock on the devise so it obviously was not useful for my dad. The unit is not returnable so now I am stuck with a useless product. Even with regular socks, my dad has a size 11 foot and he could not fit his foot into the devise even for normal socks. Very disappointed with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Dalpe

customer_reviews.title: What a relief!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after osteoarthritis of the hip made it extremely painful to put socks on my right foot. Now I am able to do so unassisted and with minimal pain. You have to stretch the sock quite wide to fit it onto the device and it might take a few experiments to get it to work right, but once you get the knack it becomes easier and easier. Tip: don't pull the sock all the way onto the device. Keep it bunched at the end, up until the toe of the sock. As you pull up on the ropes, it easily pulls the sock over your foot and up the leg.
customer_reviews.author: J. E. Campo

customer_reviews.title: Such a pain to use...
customer_reviews.text: The idea of the product is great. However, it is so difficult to use it. Putting the socks on this product itself was difficult to begin with. The elders that use this product usually have weak hand grip as well. So... Not a recommendable product IMO
customer_reviews.author: Heeman Park

customer_reviews.title: You can't compress this enough to get a sock on it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to assist me in putting on both compression socks and "regular" hiking socks. IT IS HUGE! And it's so inflexible that I couldn't get a sock on it. It was completely worthless to me. If anyone has any suggestions, I'd be happy to listen. I had one of these (different brand) years ago that worked great, but I lost it in a move. Back to the drawing board...
customer_reviews.author: Maurine

customer_reviews.title: Don't plan to use it for compression stockings.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mother to try on her compression stockings but she wasn't able to use it. The stockings were probably too long and would not slide off the aid. She is not physically able to wrestle with it so we gave up on it. I think it would be great for regular men's socks.
customer_reviews.author: Carol F.

customer_reviews.title: Not designed for compression stockings but workable
customer_reviews.text: It is similar to a previous sock aide I had that cracked, but the handles looked helpful. They are, but getting compression stockings on it is a chore. I put silicon on the inside and it facilitates my foot sliding through. the larger foam pad does help carry the stocking up higher on my leg. Very nice. Adjustable cord is a great feature. After my recent back surgery it allowed me to use my leg for pressing my foot through rather than pulling the cords thus reducing the pressure on my back muscles. The company's video demo is helpful. It is accessible from web address on insert in package.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. James F. Daiker

customer_reviews.title: Good for a Home Care Trunk Box
customer_reviews.text: I use this frequently during home care visits with patients who have recently had total hip replacement surgery, or who are obese, or have limited range of motion in their hip(s). I like the foam handles and that there are two separate cords to pull on rather than one long loop. I wish that the inside knots were smaller and that the device itself was a tiny bit wider. Additionally, the black band that helps the sock to remain on the device is a little too effective and makes it difficult for some patients to pull the sock onto the device itself. Overall, this particular sock aid is my preferred one to use with patients.
customer_reviews.author: Tweety Bird

customer_reviews.title: Not for compression stockings.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 91 year old mother to assist her putting on her compression stockings. It didn't work. I tried to return for a refund and was told this was ineligible . And yet on the product description they say there is a 60 day guarantee. I tried to return 3 days after receiving, well within the guarantee time.
customer_reviews.author: D. E. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: TOENAIL SAVER
customer_reviews.text: LOOKS NICE, IT IS GOOD FOR KEEPING YOUR COMPRESSION SOCK FROM PEALING OFF YOUR TOENAILS.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Misleading description of product capabilities
customer_reviews.text: This product is advertised as being compatible with most compression socks. Very questionable claim. I bought this to assist with regular knee high, 20 - 30 mmHg compression. Tried numerous ways of mounting the socks and pulling them on , but nothing works. No instructions for compression socks provided. It might work for some short compression socks, but I wasted my money..
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great helpful aid!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for husbands recent hip replacement as he wasn’t able to bend down far enough to get his sock on the foot of the leg that had the replacement. Works like a charm! Only problem is that he still needs help getting his sock off ! :) That too will happen within time. At least he feels good about being able to dress himself again. Would highly recommend for anyone having hip or knee surgery.
customer_reviews.author: Bonana

customer_reviews.title: Good for bad backs
customer_reviews.text: I saw a lot of back surgery patients using this in rehab hospital. Unfortunately it is hard for me to get compression socks on sleeve. ‘But, I had a stroke. So I really only need something to open sock past the toes. Don’t have hand strength to open sock enough. Will update when I try with regular socks. It must work well or hospital wouldn’t have recommended it to so many. And patients wouldn’t have been so pleased. Just remembered I Had one before when I only had arthritis in my back. Lost it after improved with new medicine. It does work.
customer_reviews.author: Alton Williams

customer_reviews.title: This item CANNOT be returned!
customer_reviews.text: I should have paid more attention to the returns policy. I am 5'3", 110 lbs. My socks cannot fit over this device, so I will donate it. The concept is good, but be sure to check out the dimensions in the product description. No way, no how, could I get my socks over this plastic form. Am sure it can be useful, just make sure your socks will fit over this form.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Nana

customer_reviews.title: Great for people who can quite reach or struggle to ...
customer_reviews.text: My mother has one of these and she felt every older person she knows needed one. It's changed her outlook. She was struggling due to a recent illness and this has helped her be more independent. Great for people who can quite reach or struggle to get their socks on.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Epps

customer_reviews.title: WIsh it worked.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the aid because I wear compression socks, and usually need my husband’s help, which is a problem when he’s not at home. THe descriptions said the device was good for compression socks, but I could never get the socks on the device to even attempt putting them on my feet. Most likely will return it.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Best way to put on socks if your flexibility and range of motion is limited.
customer_reviews.text: This product is a godsend. Although I am younger, I have put on a lot of weight lately, and I have a hip injury, so my range of motion has been severely limited. I had to ask my wife to help me put on my socks. Now this devise gives me the freedom to do this for myself. Very easy to use. Now I don’t have to wear slides everyday because I didn’t put on socks. Whoever reads this may think I am exaggerating, but this is easily the BEST amazon purchase I have EVER made. There is NOTHING like the freedom to be able to dress yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher McLean

customer_reviews.title: Liked it enough to buy another....then another.
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it says; it helps putting on socks when you can't reach your feet. Was given one after the hospital visit and back surgery (different brand) it was almost impossible to use. With this one the sock install on the device is a little challenging, but very doable. Then putting the sock on your foot is very simple. If you can't reach the top of your foot (ankle), then sliding the sock further onto the device will full slide the sock on your foot. Since I work out, I have one every place I may put on socks. Great device for those that can't get a sock over their toes.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Atkins

customer_reviews.title: It looks like it might be useful
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for my husband who had just gotten out of the hospital and needed to wear compression socks. I watched the video and we tried to use it. My husband has wide feet and they did not fit into the plastic piece that you needed to put your foot to get the sock up. And because of the Covid situation, I could not return the product. Thankfully, it was not too expensive of a purchase. Please do not consider this a bad review. It might work for others with slimmer feet.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Groves

customer_reviews.title: Great Aid for Putting on Socks
customer_reviews.text: This device is very useful for putting on socks. So far, I've used it only with low "no show" socklets and regular socks (haven't tried it with hosiery-like knee highs for more formal wear.). It works just as the photos and accompanying brochure show. My one concern is that the tube over which you stretch out the socks and into which you put your foot is really large (I do not have small feet; wear women's 9.5 shoes...), and I hope that socks are not too stretched out when I use it. If there were a smaller size, I would have purchased that.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Useless for me after knee replacement
customer_reviews.text: This didn't work for me after knee replacement. I (38m) bought this to help with putting socks on after a partial knee replacement. I could barely get my socks (men's medium) over the device. The material it is made out of stuck to my skin so it was hard to slide my foot forward into the sock. Once there, it took so much force to get my foot to slide further and pull the sock off the device (which was very tight) that it hurt. I never successfully got a sock on using this. After about 3-4 days I was able to bend enough that I could put socks on without my wife helping or this device. It was useless.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Does not work as advertised or as video shows
customer_reviews.text: Plastic is so stiff it is hard for a senior to put a sock on the tube, the tube is painful to pull up on the leg. Other than that there is no issue, except my senior Mom can use it or get a sock on with it. Nice video, but not the reality you will experience.
customer_reviews.author: Clay Melugin

customer_reviews.title: Ruining my socks
customer_reviews.text: The concept was good, but. I've had elastic at the top of everyday socks broken by the width of the sock aid. As for my compression socks, I can get the sock on to the heel, but then the sock aid gets too wide to fit through the foot of the sock, so I have to slide my foot through from the heel to the toe. When I have succeeded in getting the compression socks on, I have found little bits of elastic stuck to the plastic. I think the tube needs to be narrower.
customer_reviews.author: SueC

customer_reviews.title: No more knee pain
customer_reviews.text: I have had knee pain for some time and putting on my sock on my left foot was a chore and left me with my leg on bed and knee pain horrible trying to put my sock on. After using this product and not putting stress on my knee my knee pain is much better and able to climb stairs and back on treadmill. Easy to use for short and high socks and great price and fast delivery. Bought a second for my son in law waiting for knee replacement and he was amazed how great it helped.
customer_reviews.author: John Cadwallader

customer_reviews.title: I ordered another brand
customer_reviews.text: I had hip replacement surgery and this is what the doctor recommendation. I have a 13 eee foot it is too narrow for my foot. I’ve been wearing supposed socks for 65 years, I can not get them on this unit because it’s too wide.I can not put the socks on for fear of dislocation of hip replacement
customer_reviews.author: Myles

customer_reviews.title: This is a really well designed sock donor.
customer_reviews.text: The plastic on this seems a bit too thin. I don't know how long it will last but it works good. Most sock donors of the same stile only have a black dot on the back which usually eventually comes off. This one has a band on the back to help keep the sock on until fully pulled on. I think it won't wear off? It is certainly economical. I don't know if it would hold up long on a real strong compression sock but seems okay for normal socks or light compression socks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Less stress getting dressed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a birthday present for my aunt who suffers from cerebral palsy. She has a very hard time getting her socks and shoes on in the mornings and I decided to look for something like this that could help. After looking at some similar items I chose this one, and we are not disappointed. She loves using it and can now put on her socks without any help or pain, and it takes less time for her to get ready now. The foam at the end keeps the socks in place and the ropes can be adjusted. It's very simple and easy to use. I highly recommend this to anyone with limited mobility or joint pains.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This product is great. I have a very bad back with sciatica down both legs. I could not get my socks on it was too painful, if you're like me you want to keep your independence. This product allows you that little bit of independence you would lose otherwise. My socks glide right up the leg, I wear the diabetic socks for men I got them on Amazon they are made in America they are a very good sock and also got the Leader show mens shoes, also very excellent product. Three hits is a great score for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works ok but with issues.
customer_reviews.text: This sock puller works as described but there are a couple issues. First the surface is very glossy which makes it difficult to slide your foot into it to put your sock on. I have to use a foot powder to get it to work. Second would not just be an issues with this item but all with this design. They really don’t work well if you have bigger feet. I wear a size 13 men’s shoe and my feet are in the wider size so the space your foot goes into is a little tight so it makes it hard to pull the sock up with the sock puller.
customer_reviews.author: Louis M.Salciccioli

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth a try
customer_reviews.text: Product came nicely packaged and with instructions. Have done a trial use as it is only the start of cooler weather in the south. I need to mount the sock onto the open tube form but this is easier than bending or kneeling to help another person guide a sock over toes. The cord will need to be adjusted but it is designed for adjustment. The only concern is the stretching of the sock but it seemed to go back to form ok. It seems it will be a good assistance in helping another person get on socks.
customer_reviews.author: Tink

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with compression socks
customer_reviews.text: Quite disappointed with the sock-aid. I ordered this for my spouse, who recently had spine surgery. The tool is so stiff that it cannot accommodate compression socks, which was the reason I purchased it. When I tried to return it, the item is marked as unable to return. The seller states a 60 day guarantee and I do not recall seeing any notice about not permitting a return at time of purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Paige Breen-Page

customer_reviews.title: So Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: “This is a wonderful tool. It is so easy to use. I would highly recommend this product especially for anyone struggling putting on their socks. I put it in my with my socks and use it every day. It is also a great tool to use with compression socks. Thanks for making such a great tool.”
customer_reviews.author: CH

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful & useful contraption!
customer_reviews.text: Here I am 6 days out of a complete knee replacement & this contraption has enabled me to not just put on socks by myself, but even footed tights! Blessings to the person who designed this!
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: may work for socks, but not for thigh or waist high compression stockings
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item because I couldn't get my disabled roommate's waist high compression stockings on and her PT suggested it. It's extremely hard to get the stocking bunched up over and past it and my roommate can't help by pulling on the ropes. We haven't found an alternative yet, though, so you could try it if you're desperate. It also probably would work for compression ankle or calf high socks.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Kay

customer_reviews.title: Great help for people that struggle with mobility
customer_reviews.text: This is the second unit I have used, the first was from another company. Works very well, is easy to use and this particular unit has a much better re-inforced strip at the top to keep it from cracking and eventually collapsing. This may happen over time but the first one lasted only a year. Regardless it's a good thing to have and the price is right as well.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: These don’t work on Compression Socks
customer_reviews.text: The “Sock Assist” does not work with my Compression Socks! ;((((((. Just tried and tried! This is NOT A COMPLAINT! I read it was for all kinds of socks, and got excited!! They are hard enough putting on, so hoped the “Sock Assist” would “help?” Not at all ;(((
customer_reviews.author: Mark S.

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to use.
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I had tremendous difficulty getting his 15-25 strength compression sock onto the contraption more than a little bit. It was harder than trying to put the sock on my husband's foot without any stocking "aid." And I could see that it very well might rip a sock when trying to put it on the thing. Very disappointed. They should make it so it's small to start with and then can be expanded to stretch the sock.
customer_reviews.author: pianoteacher

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I have severe arthritis in my knee not being able to bend it to put on my compression socks - My wife would have to help me put it on. I looked at all the similar items and purchased this one. It takes a little bit of tile to stretch out the sock over the tube - but i get the sock over it - even with a new pair of compression socks - and yikes the thing works - really just what i needed - Great product at least for my needs ! - It would be nice to have a product to help take the socks off.
customer_reviews.author: grandpajoey

customer_reviews.title: Skeptical boyfriend is now a believer
customer_reviews.text: this was purchased for my boyfriend. He has limited range of motion which made putting on his compression socks difficult and time consuming. He's a big boy, with big feet and big legs so he was skeptical that this silly looking contraption would work for him. Once he tried it, he was converted! He can put his socks on in record time now.
customer_reviews.author: Pam Ives

customer_reviews.title: worked well but could be better
customer_reviews.text: purchased for husband because of hip surgery. had hard time getting some of the support stocking on the frame he could get them on the frame but when he went to put his foot in the white part it was closed in by the compression of the socks and could not slide his foot into the white tube. I had to fight to get them on his foot which put him in pain.
customer_reviews.author: Rita

customer_reviews.title: Video demo
customer_reviews.text: I'm thinkin, most people get this to help with compression sox. I spent more time gettin it on the assist and frankly the time spent and still not able to get my foot in the assist. I'm very disappointed that who did the video, shoulda do it with compression socks. I can get my compression socks on without the assist. Hopefully folks that are contemplating buying this product for compression sox, is a waste, look for other products.
customer_reviews.author: Johndog

customer_reviews.title: Sock Assist
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item for my son who has MS and has difficulty putting his socks on. He hasn't used it yet, but I will update once he does. I'm hoping he will be able to manage putting the sock on the device as he has tremors in his left hand. The item came quickly and Vive Health has offered their support if there's any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Ann Roy

customer_reviews.title: GREAT FOR MANY USESERS BUT NOT FOR EVERYONE
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to try this Vive Sock Aid easy on-off Stocking Slider. The video was very helpful in demonstrating the donning technique that makes the donning look so easy. However, I have surgically placed metal plates and screws on my ankle bones and the hard, stiff plastic was just too painful on my ankle. I am so sorry that I am unable to use it. Bummer!
customer_reviews.author: Cloud.9 Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: More sturdy than the pics suggest
customer_reviews.text: I read a review that indicated this was a flimsy device. I didn't find that at all, seemed quite ridged considering the open diameter. Having said that the first thing I did was put a bowling knot in the rope to make the handles perpendicular to the rope which I know will help me with my arthritis as I am pulling the sock over my foot. Since I haven't had my surgery yet, I haven't tested it out,so that why 4 stars. I will edit up or down after I actually use it.
customer_reviews.author: Rickster

customer_reviews.title: Easy To Use
customer_reviews.text: Ordered device to use after hip replacement surgery. Suggest practicing a few times prior to needing it. Once I got the hang of it, piece of cake. Have only used on sports socks, the kind that end below the ankle. It's been quite the lifesaver. Don't know how it would work with socks that come up over the calf but for the low ankle socks, it works great. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: MollyMutt

customer_reviews.title: Not for compression socks!
customer_reviews.text: I needed help with getting my husband's compression socks on. Thinking that this product would help with that. NOT! I struggled to get the sock on the plastic assist then he could not get his foot in far enough and then we both struggled to get it pulled out. Needless to say this was a total bust for what I needed it for.
customer_reviews.author: Snarkyboomer

customer_reviews.title: It takes a little getting used to but it works ...
customer_reviews.text: It takes a little getting used to but it works well. The compression socks don't stretch much and it can be a struggle to get them on the device but it does work.
customer_reviews.author: JaneScott

customer_reviews.title: Sock aid too difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my mom who has trouble putting on her compression socks. The problem is, it’s as difficult to put the sock on the aid as it is to put it on her foot. This might be useful for men size socks or loose socks for someone who can’t reach their feet. Didn’t see that this seller doesn’t offer returns, so I’ll be donating it.
customer_reviews.author: Avid reader

customer_reviews.title: Not for small feet!
customer_reviews.text: I would like to return this item but apparently it is not returnable right now. It is so wide that it stretches out the socks badly. I bought it for my mother who is 94 years old and it’s difficult for her to use because she cannot get the sock over the wide base. This item might work better for somebody with bigger feet and big socks.
customer_reviews.author: Duffy Cleveland

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Had to get my hip replaced and after few weeks went by, I found it inconvenient to keep asking someone to help me put on my socks. I was beginning to feel helpless and a burden to others. I seen this product on Amazon and decided to order it I felt I needed desperately to change my situation. When I received it some of my family members started to laugh. They said how is that contraption going to help you put on your socks? Let me tell you this was the best thing I ever did, it worked like a charm the first time and every time I used it. I am a free man now.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen Dentato

customer_reviews.title: This really works effortlessly; I absolutely love it!
customer_reviews.text: This really works. I wasn't sure from the Amazon video but I tried it anyway because the cost was affordable. And it works getting on those stretchy socks that don't want to go on! Even better than that, it works on small footie socks; the kind that just slips onto your feet and has no length to it (tennis socks?). I was delighted that you can even get these on now and they were often the hardest to put on my feet because there was nothing to grab onto.
customer_reviews.author: Bev Naleway

customer_reviews.title: Not user friendly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product after my husband had hip replacement surgery. Usually people who need this type of surgery are well on their way to being elderly, and lack the hand strength of younger people. If this product would have been made of cloth or lighter plastic, it would have been more senior friendly. As it is, it takes the both of us to squeeze the plastic and add the sock that needs to be put on.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen T

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me
customer_reviews.text: Vive Sock Aid: It is sturdy, and might work for someone but not me. I put the sock onto the plastic got my foot into the sock & pulled. It went halfway up my foot. There seemed to be no way to get it over my heel nor could I push the sock off the end of the plastic form onto my foot. I had to remove my sock from the assist & put it on myself. Tough to do 3 days after knee replacement. I think the design is lacking.
customer_reviews.author: Greta

customer_reviews.title: not good for bad hands & fingers
customer_reviews.text: due to C . lost feeling in my hands and feet and they don't grip as before your sock puller upper is way too difficult to put the actual compression sock on --- ended up cryling twice when trying to use . Would like to return -- however if your hands work my friend showed how it does work -- isw well made & strong and nice looking -- no good if you have neuropathy etc
customer_reviews.author: helen mcnaughton

customer_reviews.title: Not ideal if you have wide feet
customer_reviews.text: If your a wide foot type of person this will be a challenge. I'm a size 14 6E shoe guy and once in awhile my foot swells from gout. The shoot is sturdy but not wide enough. I've got to put my foot in sideways and wiggle it into the sock slowly while holding down the rear hard plastic. The sock does get up half way of my foot and i gotta pull the rest of the way manually. If they could make the plastic shoot a little wider would be good.
customer_reviews.author: LK

customer_reviews.title: Too hard to use.
customer_reviews.text: I could barely get my socks on this because it is too solid and doesn’t bend ver easily. I bought a different one that bends easily. I wouldn’t buy this unless you hand very strong hands.
customer_reviews.author: 1olygirl

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money, IT IS NOT RETURNABLE
customer_reviews.text: I you are buying this for compression socks, Then don't it does not work well if you have large legs. They will not take it back. You are just out of $10.00 Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Put on socks with no stress or discomfort!
customer_reviews.text: I am 73 years old and suffer from osteoarthritis. This product has been a blessing for me. I purchased one at the same time for a 93 year old friend who suffered a back injury from falling off the chair trying to put on a sock. They love the sock aid and hopefully will never struggle with socks again.
customer_reviews.author: Keyboard K

customer_reviews.title: Some things I can't live without.
customer_reviews.text: Due to physical restrictions (fat, old, and stiff as a board), I am unable to put on my socks. With this product, I am able to do it with it with minimal effort. It is a lifesaver product and I recommend it. I gave it a four because it is not always easy to use and takes a little getting used to before it works every time.
customer_reviews.author: SGB

customer_reviews.title: Failed to aid in donning compression socks
customer_reviews.text: Could not get the compression sock on it no matter how hard we tried. Also not allowed to return it. Buyer beware. My foot is woman’s 9. The compression hose are xl.
customer_reviews.author: Indigo

customer_reviews.title: Not for Knee High Compression Socks
customer_reviews.text: This sock aid design did not allow knee high compression socks to be put on over the foot. When the sock was installed on the plastic sock aid, the open end of the aid was narrowed down to the point where my foot could not be put through the opening. I have therefore returned this device to VIVE.
customer_reviews.author: JCP

customer_reviews.title: Too hard to use.
customer_reviews.text: My husband is unable to put his own socks own so we got this hoping it would help, but it is so hard for us to get the sock on it, we are unable to use. It was too late to return when we realized we could neither one use it. He is 80 and I am 77 with arthritic hands. Shipping was very quick.
customer_reviews.author: Meme

customer_reviews.title: Works very well, even compression socks
customer_reviews.text: I have wide feet and large calves. This product works great. A takes a little while to compression socks at 20mmHg, but it works great. I have to adjust the top of the sock but I can do it on my own. Very pleased with this one. I tried another style of sock assist before this one, but it did not work at all for me.
customer_reviews.author: T-Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Useful tip
customer_reviews.text: When putting the sock on the device. align the toe with the big toe eg right foot have the toe more toward the inner part and visa versa for the left foot. Since the big toe enters the sock first it is easier to pull the sock onto the foot. Great product if you have a bad knee and can not. bend the knee enough to put on your socks. make sure the sole of your foot is dry otherwise it will stick to the devise.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Kahan

customer_reviews.title: must have skinny legs to use this
customer_reviews.text: I think it would work better if the top part was wider. It puts the sock over my foot but then gets stuck on my calf. . Since I can't return this I am going to try using a heat gun to try to widen the upper half . I have one that is extra wide but then the socks won;t go over it.
customer_reviews.author: Two fat ladies

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: This seems wider than the Sock Ez I ordered before. I also like the wide foam at the back which is much larger than on the other brand I tried. If it breaks, as the other did, I'll add a notation to this review. I've only had it for a couple of weeks, but it seems bigger and I hope it will be sturdier.
customer_reviews.author: Mo

customer_reviews.title: Bad design
customer_reviews.text: This product is so stiff and difficult to get the socks on that it is close to worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Lane

customer_reviews.title: If you're a woman with an average-sized foot...
customer_reviews.text: If you're a woman with an average-sized foot, find this product in a smaller size than was available to ME. Fortunately, I have a fairly large foot, so my socks (just barely) fit over this device. This sock-aid is a GREAT idea, but if you have socks that are of an average size for women, the socks won't be able to fit over the device! Find this device somewhere online where you can order a smaller size!
customer_reviews.author: Jean A Morrow

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with compression stockings
customer_reviews.text: My husband has Parkinson’s. He tried to use this for his compression stockings. He said he could struggle and put the stockings on WITHOUT this contraption faster than he could get the stocking on the plate. I see not eligible for return?? I was on hold with Vive for 15 minutes and then click. Don’t buy from them!
customer_reviews.author: foolmeonce

customer_reviews.title: It’s easy
customer_reviews.text: I have been struggling for years now to reach down. And pull my socks. On, especially tight socks, I am thrilled with my new sock puller on. It is so easy to use. Just put your sock on the tube., place your foot into the sock and pull it right on. I love it, you will, too.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work very well with big feet.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these when I hurt my back and needed some assistance putting on socks. The reviews were good so I purchased one. Following the instructions I was only able to get the sock onto the first half of my foot but the whole thing jammed up at that point and I coudln't get the sock over my heel. After trying with various styles of socks and having it fail every time I gave up.
customer_reviews.author: P. Baer

customer_reviews.title: Great for being independent
customer_reviews.text: It must have for those of us who have to wear compression socks. Also it is great for those with limited bending power and want to stay independent. I have recommended this product to others who similar issues. I rarely need help putting on socks when using this device. It is well built and can handle the stress from compression sock materials.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Sock aid is truly helpful.
customer_reviews.text: I like this sock aid as it helps to get those compression socks on more readily. I had to get used to the hardness of the plastic form, and once had to use some powder when it was humid and my foot did not slide in or out. Overall, I am pleased with it and the seller was very prompt.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: A waste of time and $
customer_reviews.text: If you have a wide foot save your money. Very disappointed with this product. The time it takes you to put the compression sock on this contraption you could have both socks on
customer_reviews.author: Howard Davis

customer_reviews.title: Simple device for anyone to use!
customer_reviews.text: As a Physical Therapist Assistant I often order products for my patients or recommend items for them to order themselves. This sock aid is easy for my patients to use and does not require too much effort. You simply slide your sock on the device with the sole of the sock on the rounded bottom of the device until toe of sock is across open end (toe end). Don’t pull sock top over the rope knots. Hold rope handle in each hand and place the device on the floor. Slide foot in until your toes are at the toe of the sock. Pull handles to slide sock onto foot. Easy peasy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty well
customer_reviews.text: Purchases this because I had a hip replacement and cannot put on my sock. Overall this work well but you need to put a little talcum power on the sleeve before you put your foot in. Otherwise, your foot sticks to the plastic and you have to pull like crazy to get the sock on.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Smith

customer_reviews.title: Much easier to use.........
customer_reviews.text: Much better device than one advertised on TV. It is easier to handle and sock goes on much better. Inserting foot into the sleeve is much easier as ropes allow the device to be lowered to the foot and positioned. Wish I had really had a better look at this one than the one I purchased earlier.
customer_reviews.author: PaintBrushLass

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with compression socks.
customer_reviews.text: This product made it hard to get compression hose on. My daughter tried it also and she had same problem. Once foot in sock, it did not pull up by ropes as it was supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just right
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this thing, being that I recently had hip surgery it helps me to be able to put on my socks with ease!
customer_reviews.author: Baroness Travis

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic aid!
customer_reviews.text: My husband had hip replacement surgery and after 2 weeks of putting on his socks, I investigated an apparatus to replace me! I read the reviews on a variety of aids and opted for Vive. We could not be happier! With the lest amount of effort, my husband employed the device the first attempt! My back is forever thankful! Woo-hoo!
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla Merryman

customer_reviews.title: Size issues
customer_reviews.text: This product seems to be designed for people with larger legs than mine -- big men, maybe, or people who have a lot of edema, or people who are overweight. I wanted to use it for putting on compression stockings, but it's hard to get them onto the sock aid (because it's apparently designed for a larger or stretchier sock). If I do get the stocking onto the sock aid, it seems to be bad for the stocking -- stretching it too much, even tearing it. If you have big legs or are using it only for very stretchy soft socks, it would be easy and convenient. Otherwise, not so much.
customer_reviews.author: JI

product_meta.title: Vive Sock Aid - Easy On and Off Stocking Slider - Donner Pulling Assist Device - Sock Helper Aide Tool - Puller for Elderly, Senior, Pregnant, Diabetics - Pull Up Assistance Help
feature_bullets: EASILY PUT ON SOCKS: Easily put on your own socks or hosiery with the sock assist device. Perfect for those recovering from surgery, injury or those with limited mobility. Latex-free plastic shell contours to slide over the foot and heel, pulling up the sock with ease.
COMFORT GRIP FOAM HANDLES: Each handle is built up with a 3 cm foam padding for a secure and comfortable grip.
SLIP-RESISTANT CUFF: A wide, slip-resistant cuff ensures the sock does not slide off of the sock assist.
ADJUSTABLE CORD LENGTH: Sock assist cords are 33” in length. Simple length adjustments can be made with the button adjustors.
VIVE GUARANTEE: 60 day guarantee so you can purchase now with confidence.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
